input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to take an internal bath?
input_text.Response A: Sure!  An internal bath is a kind of spa treatment that you can perform yourself.  You sit in a warm bath with a few drops of essential oil or a few spoonfuls of a natural oil or herbal remedy.  It’s a great way to relax and take care of your health.  You can also take a hot shower or a warm bath with a few drops of essential oil or a few spoonfuls of a natural oil or herbal remedy.  You can also take a warm shower or a warm bath with a few drops of essential oil or a few spoonfuls of a natural oil or herbal remedy.
input_text.Response B:
Sure! An internal bath is a way to clean yourself when you don’t have access to a shower or a bathtub. First, you’ll want to get undressed and put on a clean set of underwear or pajamas. Then you’ll want to fill a basin or a bowl with warm water. You’ll want the water to be warm, but not hot, so that it feels comfortable on your skin. You’ll want the water to be deep enough that you can submerge your underarms, and you’ll also want to make sure the water isn’t so deep that you’ll be uncomfortable balancing it on your lap.

Once you have the water prepared, you’ll want to sit on the edge of the bathtub or on a chair with your knees bent, and you’ll want to lean forward so that your bottom is off the edge of the bathtub or the chair, and your thighs are parallel to the floor. Make sure you’re comfortable and that you’re not going to slip or fall
